topic: Need feature that Android app has
review:
Overall I am pleased with the iOS Fitbit app. For reference, I have the Charge 2. What would make it a 5star app would be the ability for me to edit my workouts with the ability to add my own text. I want to be able to record the exact workout I did, not just choose from basic selections like "interval workout"! When I complained about the lack of this feature to a friend, I was blaming Fitbit...until she showed me how to do exactly what I wanted...on her Android app! 
 Come on i-app developers...this should be easy to do!

I wanted to sync my iPad and my phone so I downloaded the app on both but the iPad just stays one way(direction) no matter how I turn my iPad and that drives me crazy!! Really it can't be but so hard for Fitbit to add an update and fix this annoying problem.ï¿½

The app works great with the fitness trackers, but the nutrition tacking section needs work among other things. 
 
 - Why is it when I scan a bottle of water to add it to my meal, it doesn't also add to my water consumption totals? So many other food tracking apps have this feature. ADD IT ASAP!
 
 - Why can I not create custom water sizes to track water intake? It gets really annoying having to manually set the amount consumed each and every time. Let us create customer container sizes for faster water tracking. 
 
 - Why is there no recipe nutrition calculator for creating your own recipes and knowing the nutritional information for said recipes?
 
 - Why is there STILL no widget? This annoys me so much.
I love my fit bit but the band is a little hard to put on.

I keeping getting sleep patterns instead of stages for most of the days of the week, I only get stages every so often. When I first got my Alta hr a month ago it worked great and showed the stages, why mostly patterns now???
TBH, I like the jawbone app much better. I can manage with the Fitbit app and the interface is alright. But Jawbone's graphical representations are better.

Since the sleep element has been updated to record R.E.M. etc sleep I am now averaging an extra hour of sleep per night. I wish it was because the new sleep app was more accurate but it isn't. It regularly shows me as asleep when I was awake and reading. Disappointing as I previously loved this app!
Interested to see how this works but so far it seems good and it was easy to set up. I wish it had support for WhatsApp or other notifications like the Android version does.

 Excited about the tracking data this can provide. Just so hard to extract it.

I came back from a good sporting advent and I have 4 glowing dots on my Flex and I try to stink with my iPad mini 2 10G 
 And it resets my stats to 0 and I'm quite angry about that I haven't hade this happen before so I hope it was a one time thing or something if it is a glitch I hope you can fix it
I must have climbed 8 flights of stairs today, the tracker did not sense it. It used to work great, what happened?

I've just started using the app and the Fitbit. As much as I like it, it's not accurate. It's counting movements and not steps (on the step counter) it's frustrating because I'm not really sure how hard I've worked.
My Fitbit Alta hasn't synced in dayyysss and I'm getting really annoyed bc it use to sync really fast and now I have to wait 2 to 3 days for it to sync! Why does this keep happeningggg?!
Expected more.

Everything seems fine, except exercise not syncing (iPhone 7+, v 10.3.2). 
 
 Might want to fix soon since this affects 80% of your customer base.
Not sure why but the app continually syncs even with all day sync off. Not accurately displaying info because if that. Please fix it!
I need a record of my heart rate.The app is not recording that.
The app is ok it syncs up with tracker pretty fast.The only thing I'm disappointed with is that it tracks in kilometres rather than miles

topic: Problems when using two Fitbit trackers
review:
I currently own two Fitbit trackers: a Charge HR and a Charge 2.
 
 I use the Charge 2 most of the time, but cut over to the Charge HR when engaged in activities that could scratch the face of the Charge 2, such as gardening.
 
 Recently, I have found that changing back to the Charge 2 and synching causes the steps counted while wearing the Charge HR to be ignored in the total daily steps, reverting back to what the total was before the Charge HR was used.Subsequent synching of the Charge HR causes it to revert back to the same daily total as displayed in the App.However, when you look at the hourly graph of steps taken for the day, the steps from both trackers are clearly still displayed.It is just the total daily steps that is wrong.
 
 This is a recent bug as I previously had no issues keeping steps up to date with the two trackers.
Had charge hr but it broke , charge 2 has better display but disappointed with silent alarm and notifications , heaps better on hr

I bought the Alta HR off QVC. I called on the phone and asked questions about how it tracks your steps. I returned the last Fitbit I had cause my steps were over 10,000 steps by lunchtime and didn't walk that much. I wore the Fitbit on my less dominant hand and I am now. It's muchbetter than the last one but I don't think it's accurate. I move my hands all day. I take little steps around the chair and walk back and forth mixing color, getting my clients and walking them out. I'm thinking about sending this one back too. I love all the things I can track, sleep patterns, count calories, track my heart rate, how many days I workout, and my weight loss. I like seeing who calls and text me. I'm a independent hairstylist and I can tell when I need to get back with my clients trying to make appointments without pulling out my phone. That's a great plus. Please fix this glitch and more hairstylist will buy this.

I have the new Alta HR which I love and I kept my old Flex. When the Alta needs to charge I'll wear my Flex. This was never an issue my steps would sync together at the end of the day. Recently, if I wear my Flex for a day and then come home and sync with the Alta, all of my steps erase. It's infuriating

topic: Setup will not finish on Alta HR
review: Originally bought the Alta HR for me but my wife decided she wanted one so I bought a smaller band and gave the Alta HR to her. I deleted it from my iPhone and changed the registration to her and attempted to sync the downloaded app to her iPhone but it will not finish the setup process.I took my new charge 2 and put it in another room, then restarted my Bluetooth per the instructions, but still can't get the Alta HR to finish the setup.Not very happy right now because I can't find a solution to my problem.The charge 2 is working fine.

Ok so I've been hearing about Fitbit brand for a long time as a professional in cellular/mobile IT. Never had a reason to buy one, finally did with a deal bogo for me and my gf. First of all, the app isn't capable of a couple mode. Why? I have to log in and out of two accounts. You need the option to have several people and associated tracker on the same account. Which brings me to: It can't track sex as activity. I found I can add an activity using the website dashboard. But this is so many steps for something I really should already have automatically logged. it's basically high core moderate activity, so it registers as a larger amount of steps at once than walking around the house. So basically the only feature I can use well is the sleep logging, everything else feels half baked in terms of activity/step goals. Kinda sad I expected at least semi functionality from this brand.

The app is constantly getting better, which is definitely appreciated. New functions are being added ( sleep analysis, etc.), and old functions are improved.
 
 However, some functions still need work, challenge tab for example, is extremely laggy and freezes every time I open it.

Can't be set to auto sync once a day. All day or only when you open the app
 
 Otherwise the app works wonderfully and does not frequently crash like previous versions of the app did.
Everything seems to work ok. A good motivation device.

Have used my fitbit alta for 1 1/2 days and am very satisfied. Great fun to know what I have accomplished without guesswork and/or fabrication. I am a fan and hope this helps me achieve my health and fitness goals.

This app does what it is supposed to do, but I'm disappointed it won't update the display unless it's connected to the internet.I keep cellular data turned off on my iPhone so the app only updates when I'm on WiFi.Other than this, I would have given it 5 stars

Yay!!! Great bday gift from my honey! So far it reads all of my steps. Trying to set it up still but so far so good I'm only giving it a 4 star until I have it all set up how I want it..... if all goes well I will give it a 5!
On day 2 with Fitbit, and I'm getting off my butt.Sadly, it's the impetus I needed to unbun the couch.At age 72 it's whatever works,right?So far, so good!

Love the Fitbit and the app, only have one problem- App misses the hourly step tracking and will not sync later so either I sync with the app each hour to make sure it is logged or I have gaps that are incomplete.Please fix.

For a while, the app was frustrating me. It kept kicking me out after a few seconds, before it could sync, before I could check stats, or open challenges.It would take 3-5 attempts to finish a sync.I made sure my OS & the app were current. Finally, I just deleted & re-installed...SO much better!! Liking the app again now.
For your next update you should make a TIMER feature for the Fitbit charge 2.

The app is great and I do like it a lot....BUT......
 
 Please go back to the solid graph for the sleep tracking. This new squiggly thing is so much more difficult to read. The other one was simpler but much more effective.
Good if you are a gym fanatic. Let's you know what you what you have achieved on the day !
Sync with Apple Health & 5 stars

Quite happy with the app and Fitbit Blaze tracker. Am a middle age guy, it has defiantly encouraged me to stop being a couch potato and become a hot potato.. LOL, keep up the good work FITBIT. PS If you have the Aria scales and trying to hook up with WiFi you need three initials on set up ðŸ‘ðŸ»
Very motivating! And love the slim design of the flex

topic: Really good but a few improvements needed
review: I've only had my Charge 2 for approx 2 weeks but so far so good. As other reviewers have mentioned it's good to challenge yourself and see what you're putting into your body and working off. In an ideal world I would love a more detailed Macronutrients breakdown but I am just being picky. The only thing I really don't like is the weight function, it doesn't seem to work properly. I don't have the "smart" scales so I'm having to manually enter any weight loss in. So far I have lost 6 pounds and have recorded this on the app, although the data is all there, the dashboard shows that's I've only lost one. I've synced and re-synced but to no avail. It's only a small bug bear, love the rest of the app and the Charge 2!

And loving it on the whole :-)
 
 But sadly my 'steps per hour' have stopped updating. I'm not sure exactly when and I'm not going to research it right now.
 
 I mean, since Fitbit brought it to our attention that movement per hour matters, then it would be nice to have our movement we've done, stored and acknowledged.
 
 Thanks tech team!
It's really difficult to scroll through your active minutes. I've got no idea why this is so difficult considering everything else works brilliantly on the app. Many thanks.
Help! I can't get the text alert to work with my iPhone 7.... anybody else having same issue?

topic: Love but don't like new sleep stages
review: I LOVE my Fitbit app. Especially because it syncs with my weight watchers giving me more points the more I walk! I don't care for the new sleep stages though that shows you deep sleep times and light sleep times. It's hard to read. I liked the older sleep log better
Good app, yet there is still a room for improvement
It's very interesting to see your stats. It seems to be quite accurate. Sleep reviews are great since I have sleep apnea. Very happy with this device and app.

So far the app has been pretty straight forward.. this is only my second day ever using a fitbit, and I do really enjoy it. I mainly bought a fitbit to track my sleep and heart rate so steps and workouts are just extra for me. It's pretty cool they have the challenges and workout videos in the app which I hope to utilize in the near future. I feel being able to interact with other people in the fitbit community could be very helpful and motivating.
I like this app BUT there needs to be a driving mode because the fitbit counts steps while driving.
The app crashes when I try to open my challenges.
Nothing to complain about, happy with features

I think fitbits are okay. I think the box should have more instructions this is the only reason I could not give 5 stars. All it said was go to the App Store an download the app. One you get the app, not everything is user friendly. I wanted to enter the previous day exercise but have no idea how to do it. I have only had the Fitbit for two weeks so I am still trying to figure it out. As far as tracking it seems to be working well for my steps. I had it on when I went for a doctor appt and t wear a little off but not much for my heart rate. The nurse said it was 64. My Fitbit said 62 that is pretty close.
I absolutely love it..I've already walked 5,000 steps my first day wearing it...ðŸ˜
Works great and keeps me motivated. I love the helpful reminders to move.

So far so good! I have only had it on for a few hours, but I have a suggestion. 
 I like that there is an option to receive notifications of calls and texts, but can there be a time setting for that? I don't want those notifications while I sleep! And it's annoying to change the settings every day!
I purchased this product to assist me in keeping track of my cardio work outs. It has fulfilled this need and more.
I love my Fitbit so much it awesome I can compete with my husband even through our distance! This has improved my sleep and I love this!
Very warm and user friendly app.
I really like it it's simple and works smoothly
Really good app. Really happy with it and would recommend
I love it! It's a great motivator ï¿½
Great motivator. It will make me a more active person, no matter what the initial base level is!
I purchasedZip for a special fundraising event and it works perfectly. Hoping it will help me raise donations for cancer research.
Love it so far...ï¿½

I had tried many times in the past to use pedometers, but they never worked. The Fitbit app makes tracking exercise a breeze! I love being able to sync the Fitbit - it's so effortless. Great little motivator, seeing my progress in the app. Nice visuals and badges.

First off, I love my Fitbit. But I really wish I could either customize the notifications for the hourly 250 steps or if it would tell me every time how many I have to get. 
 
 There are times when it will tell my that I have to get 88 steps to win the hour. And other times it will tell me to go for a stroll and not tell me how many. I really wish it told you how many more you had to get every time. 
 
 Sincerely, 
 
 I love my Alta HR

Let me start by saying, I don't review apps or many products unless I hate them. But this app is amazing! I love my Fitbit Alta I got for my birthday but this app has a community of people just like me who are trying to get in shape/ stay in shape. There is no cussing, no sexual harassment, no nudity like you get on social media. It's just a bunch of people encouraging each other from all around the world!
Brilliant does just what I need tracks steps and links my bike rides. Ideal.
Awesome app that keeps you healthy lifestyle number one interesting of healing and strength ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
This was so easy to set up and I love the dashboard! Great info and many options.

Bought this as I often leave my iPhone 6s in my coat pocket when I get to work and my step count says I walk 200 steps when I know I do a big load more!! 10000 steps achieved by lunch. So accurate. Brilliant.
Bought my Fitbit last weekend & I really does what it's meant to do. I use it to track my steps, water intake & sleep. So easy to set up & the tracker itself is light & comfortable to wear!
It's doing a good job.
Great app
Love my Fitbit Alta HR

New to the Fitbit world but am loving the functionality of this app. Especially the updates and the way the app is linked directly to my Fitbit so I don't have to go and alter the data, it's all automatic.
First fit bit I've just bought.It was easy to set up, day one of using it and I'm enjoying it
Easy to use and fun to warmth your progress.
I love this
I think this is a great app. It hasn't crashed yet , or done any thing yet to upset me. I am doing the demo right now because I don't have a Fitbit now, but I can't wait to get my Fitbit

So easy to use, even for a non tecky like me. Updates perfectly and love how all the green flashes when I meet my daily goals. Great also that all you have to do is touch a category to find out more information.

I just would like to give you much kudos for designing and integrating a spectacular app for the Fitbit Alta HR!
 
 Everything I've setup has been flawless from the sleep mode to calories eaten and steps per hour to the syncing, and even the community as fair as adding friends.
 
 I'm looking forward to having great success with getting fit and staying fit.
 
 Well done!
Chuffed to bits with both my blaze and the app. They work seamlessly together and provide you with masses of information
Great, superb
